Posts.Content: Jan 2, 2017 02:42PM na_na wrote: Hi Cyndie, if you have fibrous breasts and not eligible for mammo due to your young age, please do push for MRI.
Posts.Title: not getting answers from medical staff CyndieMon tennischick888

Posts.Content: na_na wrote: Hi, I wonder if there is any way to get a second opinion on MRI, online, from highly reputable or university hospital, or a good doc? I'd very much appreciate your feedback!! I'm worried on this part of MRI report: Dense parenchymal structure was observed in both breasts, being more distinctive in the subareolar areas (type C pattern). It has a dense fibroglandular composition. 6.5x4.5 mm, 6.2x4.5 mm and 5x4 mm sized cystic changes that are characterized with hyper intense micro cysts during the T2 weighted investigations were observed. Following administration of IV contrast material, multiple circular and ovaid configuration displaying nodular opaqueness displaying area with no larger distinctive diameter than 5 mm were observed in the right breast. Posts.Content: Feb 6, 2017 08:47AM na_na wrote: Hi Scmommato3! I'm the one with cysts and lymphnodes, and scared as well. I'm waiting for my cycle to get an MRI, as the doc said it would be only informative during 5-13 days of the cycle. I will really push for PET/CT though, as these lymphnodes are driving me crazy now.
Posts.Title: Anyone with cysts and lymph nodes? Scmommato3 Scmommato3

Posts.Content: Jan 11, 2017 10:07AM - edited Jan 11, 2017 10:08AM by na_na Scmommato3, if there are no lymphnodes under your armpit, then for sure it's not IBC, as they would have been enlarged. When you get your US/MRI, ask the docs to check on your auxiliary lymphnodes, too. PS. I can't figure out how to send pms on this website.
